job_title: Products and Services in Peterborough, England
pros: - lots of variation in work - good to work with an organisation with a positive purpose - great people - committed and passionate - good career progression opportunities
cons: - given CITB role (collecting a Levy from employers to then invest for benefit of industry) there are bound to be some groups who are not supportive - and that can be challenging - supporting technology needs improvement

pros: Challenge structure and job role
cons: Pay is not very competitive

pros: Great team in Finance. Great hybrid working model.
cons: Reward quite low, even for not-for-profit

review_title: Outsourced third party nightmare, no internal progression and admin mountains
pros: The business does do worthwhile work in a number of areas
cons: The decision to move support functions over to an outsourced provider has been a disaster but the top management won't change things. It creates mountains of extra admin for employees in the business, as well as providing appalling service and more work to pick up the pieces. The internal development of people is a joke and barriers are put in place for people trying to get promotions. Despite being an NGO the turnover of staff is poor.

review_title: Don't support women in the workplace
pros: Mobile work great, meal allowance and mobile allowance also generous
cons:
Don't uphold their own policies.
Don't support women in the workplace, despite promoting women in construction.
They will dismiss you if you report sexual harassment and then try to pay you to be silent.

job_title: Assistant Manager in King's Lynn, England
pros:
Flexible working
Holiday, buy sell back
Great pay
Mobile working
cons: Constantly going through change reviews. Movies office, made most redundant, then moved back to original site.

job_title: Product and Services Coordinator in Peterborough, England
pros: very flexible with home working and hours
cons: the technology could be better

review_title: A good organisation with some misdirection from directors.
pros: The people made this a great place to work despite some adversity from the organisation's leadership and direction.
cons: Highly bureaucratic and many services outsourced to a less-than-ideal provider.r

pros: New ambitious leadership driving change
cons: Needs to be better connected

job_title: Head of Analysis and Forecasting in Bridgeton, NJ
pros: Great, flexible, considerate employer that tackles important skills issue but gets inaccurate and unfair negative publicity
cons: A bit slow and bureaucratic. Doesn't always get everything right all the time - but who does.

review_title: Absolute Joke Nial is a bare faced Liar
pros: None At all joke joke joke
cons: Stay well clear they pay nobody unless you apply pressure

review_title: Seriously avoid if you can help it
job_title: Business Planning Manager in Peterborough, England
pros:
Flexi Working/ good work life balance 
Friendly Culture 
Modern Offices 
Very Much 9-5
cons:
- Completely unorganised, flipping weekly/ daily between priorities achieving little/ nothing.
- Out of touch with the construction industry (still has a college mentality/ feel and does not understand construction at any depth and its different areas).
- Very cash strapped (due to poor choices during lockdown) and feels like it resulting in CITB quickly turning on staff, tried to reduce redundancy policy by 50% while going into its second restructure in two years.
- Really poor employee service quality, I have not had one month of the correct pay for nearly a year, many are in this position its a shambles.
- Lack of challenging poor behaviours.
- unfulfilling as a company in my opinion

review_title: No one knows what is going on
pros:
There are some great people who work here, made some great friends
If you know how to jump the hoops of recruitment you will get promotions
cons:
No one really knows what they are doing
No one takes accountability for their role, will always prefer to fob it off to someone else
Have messed up people's pay checks consistently for 2 years. Furlough has been a nightmare, finance have no idea what they are doing and CITB hiring multiple people just to figure out how to pay people correctly
Hiring process is flawed, if you don't say the correct answer to the questions they are asking you get marked down, yet you are never told what kind of answers they want.

review_title: Utterly irresponsible employer with no future
pros:
Offers a good package (although job security hinders this)
Low expectation of output 
Low hiring calibre (easy to get in)
No travel requirements
Work from home policy
cons:
- Totally disconnected from the construction industry and required support
- Awful job security, there is no future for the CITB, will likely not get the required support to continue into the future
- Awful payroll system - literally cant get payroll right (paid random amounts every month)
- Real lack of high calibre professionals, extremely armature/ incompetent culture 
- CEO stepped down during her second big restructure
- Made 100's of redundancies after less than a year into new structure off the back of making over 1000 redundancies

pros: Free lunch provided to staff
cons: Poor company goals and vision

pros: Good benefits like life insurance
cons: Communication not the best really

pros: People are nice to work with
cons: The Divestment has ruined company values

review_title: It could be great, note the could.
pros: They try, or at least they think they do.
cons: At the heart it's old fashioned, they've never broken out of the back waters of Norfolk. The shame is that it's needed, but then struggles to understand what it is needed for.

pros: Remote working, luncheon, benefits, company car
cons: Discrimination, teams lie and gang up on new staff members and bullying

pros: very nice people work here, with good intentions.
cons: chaos is everywhere and executive team is unfocused.

pros: Great team of people , good benefits package, nice part of the country. Salaries are average to good depending on where you work.
cons: Citb attempt to remodel themselves every couple of year's with sadly little positive change. The  process of change is catastrophic to the team, affecting health and motivation acutely. Senior managers are  ineffective at managing change and fallout. Good people fail recruitment  days due to the onerous, subjective poorly managed process which places little emphasis on ability and too much on ticking boxes or whether your face fits. Career progression is non existent unless you lunch with the right people, performance planning is poor with little consideration for ability and aptitude and too much emphasis on behaviours which are subjective.

pros: Some good people to work with. Good facilities but only if you are based in Bircham Newton.
cons: Extensive loss of knowledge. Senior management not letting some teams do the work they are charged with as they didn't like to hear what was going wrong. The management structure gets bigger whilst the foot soldier count gets smaller but and their workload increases.  Earlier review mentioned no weekend working, this only happens if you are based in an office, majority of staff are field based and mobile/home based and that means very little or no support you rarely get to see another if your team members as you are very busy, you often have paperwork to do as the electronic systems brought in to help don't always work.

review_title: Tired,  no real vision and too much internal politics!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Bircham Newton, England
pros: Reasonable package and the basis of what CITB stands for should make it a strong and progressive brand. Some good people.
cons: Unfortunately the directors and leadership team have no idea of vision,  but only how to build their own little empires. Slowly , but surely they are dismantling the brand and running the organisation into the ground. A real shame as it could be so progressive and enabling.

job_title: Product Manager in King's Lynn, England
pros:
35 hour week, no weekend working 
Onsite restaurant and costa coffee 
Gym facilities and swimming pool.
Flexible working for childcare
cons: Management restructure has left CITB in chaos.  Inexperienced senior managers and staff left without clear leadership or effective line management.  Morale at all time low as staff feel unappreciated and utterly ignored, unless brand new to the business and completely clueless, just like management.

job_title: Project Manager in Bircham Newton, England
pros: Good salary compared to area, good benefits, nice rural location, with good exercise facilities. Lots of good people work there.
cons: The business is undergoing continual change but without ever seemingly completing what they started.  Lost lots of very good people through redundancy, losing knowledge, skills and experience I favour of new people with little or no knowledge of the construction industry or our stakeholders. Supposed to be a leadership organisation but showing little leadership itself.

pros: If you are into the right position and nothing changes great.  I had a good six years.....
cons: I left the position due to poor team working skills and the fact that restreamlined into new working position without choice and lack of staff availability.  Bullied!

pros: CITB pays well, offer great benefits and the work is enjoyable
cons: The reorganisation is in chaos, management do not seem to understand the construction industry.  There is a bullying element within management - two colleagues had nervous breakdowns, one was admitted to hospital with stress and refused to take time off.  HR do not seem to respond and always support the manager
